    • randomVector

      public static Vector randomVector(double magnitude)
      Returns a random vector that has a magnitude of the input magnitude by using a randomly generated angle and parametric equations to get a vector with a magnitude of the radius of a circle. It then rounds these.
      Parameters:
      magnitude - The required magnitude of the output vector.
      Returns:
      Vector A new randomized vector that has a magnitude close to the input magnitude.

    • randomVectors

      public static Vector[] randomVectors(int num, int magnitude)
      Used to generate an array of specified length of random vectors with a specified magnitude.
      Parameters:
      num - The number of vectors to generate.
      magnitude - The magnitude of each vector in the output.
      Returns:
      vectors An array containing @code{num} randomized vectors of magnitude @code{magnitude}.

    • toStorageFormat

      public String toStorageFormat()
      Returns the vector in the format "x,y" for storage - this saves a lot of () in the storage file and will minorly help the read times for the coordinate list parser.
      Returns:
      string The coordinate in storage format.

    • parseVector

      public static Vector parseVector(String vectorString)
      Parses a vector from a string if the data is in the format "x,y".
      Parameters:
      vectorString - The string from which to parse a vector.
      Returns:
      vector A new vector containing the values from the string.
